Charlie Chaplin is walking down a street with quite shabby looking houses when he suddenly got hit by some trash that seemed to be thrown out of a window (which is not visible to the audience in the screen ) and should have fallen into the waste can next to Chaplin.

Chaplin lights another cigarette, throws his gloves into the trash and looks to the other side where he finds a baby covered in a blanket lying on the Floor. He looks up to the window from where the trash was thrown out and picks the baby up.

Right behind him arrives a woman with a Buggy. She seems to look for something.Chaplin tries to get her attention, while she is returning from entering a house entrance he sets the baby into the buggy to the other kid. The woman is furious and tells him after Chaplin wants to leave her with both kids in the buggy to take the kid back and he eventually does that and walks away.

Chaplin arrives at the spot where he found the baby and put it back while a policeman arrived behind him seriously scanning the Situation. Chaplin turning around and almost stumbling into the policeman returns to the baby, picks it up and walks around the corner and finds an elderly man with a walking stick. Chaplin puts the baby in his arms and fastly walks away after pretending he needs to tie up his shoe.

The elderly man quickly walks with the baby around the corner just to find a buggy with another kid inside where he places the baby and disappears. After he is gone the woman from before steps out of the entrance and looks at the buggy, gets annoyed and is likely to look for Charlie Chaplin who encounters again the police man and eventually passes without any reaction. She follows him, hits him with her umbrella and drags him back to the buggy. They argue about the baby when the policeman joints the situation. Finally, Chaplin takes the baby out of the buggy and walks away, so do the others.

Chaplin sits on the sidewalk thinking about putting the baby into a duct but then he rolls back.
He looks at the baby and finds a note saying that this baby is an orphan and needs love and care.
He smiles at the baby in his arms, gets up and walks away with it.

In this video "The boy, the kid" by Charles Chaplin is a men who is walking down a street and finds a baby wrapped up in blankets. He is trying to find the parents or just the mother of this baby. After trying to get the baby in to a carrier of a women, the women refuses the baby, that this is not her baby. Charles Chaplin is walking down the street and is getting involved with a police officer by trying to get rit of the baby on the street. He is walking around and giving the baby to an old men. At the end Charles Chaplin is keeping the baby.

column39: Background readings about the task topic (newspapers, internet, TV, etc.)
column40: In the following clip, one can see Charlie Chaplin going through a street. A few seconds later after smoking a cigarette, he discovers a child lying on the floor. He picks it up and searches for the mother. Afterwards, a mother with a child passes by. Chaplin thinks, that she might be the mother of the child. But that is not the case, because she denies being the mother. This leads to Chaplin laying the child back down where he found it, until a police officer appears. Without wanting to leave a bad impression, he picks up the child again and runs away, until he gives it to a homeless person on the way. The homeless person lays the child in a baby buggy, which belongs to the mother from a few moments ago. Of course there is no other than Charlie Chaplin who appears afterwards, which leads to the mother beating him up. The policeman appears afterwards as well, so Chaplin has to leave again with the baby. Sitting on the street with the kid, Chaplin discovers a letter and gets to know that the child has been abandoned by its parents. Finally, one can see Chaplin smiling towards the orphan holding it.

The short movie is about Charlie Chaplin finding a baby and searching for its parents. In the first sequence one can see Charlie Chaplin lighting a cigarette. By doing so he suddenly notices a baby besides the bins on the ground. He is not able to identify the parents of the baby. As he sees a woman passing by with a stroller, he suggests that it could be the mother of the baby. So he layed the baby in to the stroller. It turned out that it was not her baby. As a consequence she started mocking at Charlie, so he had to take it out of the stroller again. As he had no other idea where to place down the baby, he layed it back to the place he found the baby. But this move failed again. A officer cought him laying down the baby on the floor so he had to pick up the baby again. Once more he is disperately thinking of an other option. He encounters an old man, which he could hand over the baby with a ruse and flees right afterwards. This olderly man then sees the woman with the stroller, and puts it in the stroller as Charlie had done before. Therfore the woman suggested Charlie the one ho had put the baby in her stroller as Charlie crossed her way. She hits him with a umbrella and gives him back the baby. Charlie gives up and now realises that it is  an orphan baby as he finds a small letter which says to please take care of that orphan baby.

Charlie Chaplin walks through the streets while some residents throw trash outside their windows. Suddenly he gets hit by some of the trash a neighbour threw out and complained. As he looked down to clean himself up and light another cigar, he notices the babys cries and lift it up. In the exact moment a woman with a stroller and her own baby walks into the background of the scene, Chaplin thought that she might accidently lost her child and wanted to return it. He put the baby he just found into the stroller and implied that she dropped something, the mother reacts furious and wants him to take the baby and leave. As he walked back to the spot where he had found the baby, a police officer walked in. Chaplin notices him and picks the baby up again because he didn't want to get into trouble for abandoning the baby. He walks around the corner and notices an older man,  suddenly he had an idea how to get rid of the child for his own sake. He asked the man to hold the baby while he ties his shoe laces, he agreed and as soon as he seemed distracted Chaplin ran away. He hid in a parking lot, confused the older man searches for him and came across the stroller with a baby inside and just laid the baby he just recieved inside. As Chaplin wanted to leave the scene, the Police Officer appeared again and he knowingly avoids him. Thus he walks by the woman with the stroller, that noticed that the baby was inside her stroller again, she assumed that Chaplin had dropped it in there again and furiously attacks him with her umbrella. Angrily she drags him to the stroller and shouts at him, that he should take the baby and leave. Once again the police officer stepped into the scene and the woman seems to try to get his help but decided just to leave. Chaplin leaves the scene as well and decided to sit down on the roadside with the baby on his lap. He contemplates wherever he should get rid of the baby and looked suspiciously into the sewerage. He declined that thought and turned the baby into another position in his arms and notices a small letter in which is written that this baby is a orphan, a child without living parents and that someone should take care for the baby and treat it with love. As he realised the sad fate of this baby, he smiled at it and interacted with it quite caring and leaves the scene.

In the beginning Chaplin got almost hit by something that came from above. Due to the shock, he decided to smoke a cigarette. Furthermore, he found a baby and until the end of the film he tried to put the baby back in the baby carriage. The baby carriage belongs to a woman, which he thought, is the mother of the baby. Further protagonists are a police officer and a homeless man. The story ends with Chaplin going away with the baby.

In the beginning of the scene, Chaplin walked down a street full of  ash and wreck. As he passed the street, a man threw stones out of his window which nearly hit Chaplin. Uninterested, Charly kept smoking his cigarette and kept walking. Suddenly, he was hit by a big stone from another unknown person. He stoped and pulled out a small box out of his inner jacket pocket. He opened the box, took out a new cigarette, put off his gloves, and touched his shoe sole in order to set fire to his cigarette. Not knowing where to put his gloves, he threw them in the can next to him. As the looked to the other side, he saw a baby left alone next to the ashes on the street. He went to the baby but then looked up to the windows, thinking whether someone threw the baby out or was missing it. Then he lifted the baby up and wasn‘t sure where to go. As he saw a woman with a trolley walking behind him, he followed her. She entered into the building while Charly laid the baby in her trolley. She came out and saw a second baby in her trolley, then saw Chaplin, shoutet at him and told him to take the baby. Charly went back to the spot where he found the baby and wanted to lay it there. But then a policeman saw his act and Charly took the baby again. He walked on and saw another old man and pretended that he had to tie his shoe but then ran away. The old man followed him and then saw the trolley and put the baby in the woman‘s trolley. The woman came out of yet another shop and saw Charly walking in front of her. She hit him with her umberella and forced him to take the baby again as the policeman saw the happening. Chaplin took the baby and went away. He sat down on the street and saw a gulli, opened it and looked at the baby but then closed it again. Then he saw a letter saying:“Please love and care for this orphan child“.  He put the letter in his pocket, smiled at the baby and left the scene.

The sequence "The kid/The baby" from Charles Chaplin shows Chapling walking down a dirty street, perhaps close to a building site. Stones fall down from the rooftops and almost hit Chapling. While he grumbles about the falling rubble he sees a baby covered in blankets lying in a dirty corner. Chaplin recognizes a woman carrying a pram and assumes that the baby is hers. When Chaplin tries to put the baby back into the pram, the woman gets angry and curses at Chaplin. Cunfused, Chaplin puts the baby back into the corner, where a police officer watches him and gets Chaplin in trouble. While running away from the police officer, Chaplin places the baby in the arms of an old man, who gets confused and looks for the place where the baby might come from. The old man finds the woman with the pram, places the baby inside the pram and disappears.At this moment Chaplin arrives at the place where the woman with the pram stands. The woman blames Chaplin again, who takes the baby out of the Pram and runs away. He sits down at the kerb and thinks about what to do with the child. While he weights up whether to put the baby into the sewers, he finds a letter, whch says "Please love and care for this orphaned child". Smilingly, Chaplin puts the letter inside the pocket of his coat and leaves with the baby in his arms.

With the kid in his arm he went back to the corner from the beginning. He sat down and found a piece of paper in the blanket that the baby was wrapped in. On this paper it said: take care and love this orphan child. So he did.

The video clip "the kid - the baby" is about Charles Chaplin who randomly finds a crying baby outside on the ground. First, Chaplin is confused and does not know what he shall do. Finally, he decides to get the baby. Convinced that a passing woman  is the mother of the baby, he puts it in her buggy. But after she realizes what he did, she is furious. Chaplin, who is obviously desperate, tries to think about differently possibilities how to get rid of the baby. He observes a man walking on the street and pretends that he has to fix his shoes. In fact, he runs away. The man is confused and looks for a place for the baby. In front of a store, he finds a where he decides to put the baby. After a while, the woman who owns the buggy    comes back and hits Charles because she is of the opinion he placed the baby the man for having placed the baby in the buggy.In the end, Charles Chaplin is holding the baby again  and finds a letter in the baby's clothes which says: "Please love and care for this orphan child."

column11: English Literature, Linguistics, University Language Skills, Key Moments in the Linguistic History of the English-Speaking World
column40: In the short clip Charlie Chaplin walks down a small street. He is smoking. Suddenly someone throughs out garbage from an open window, he manages to step aside. A few steps later he is not that lucky. In anger Chaplin recognizes that is cigarette was blown out and he takes out a new one with very explicit movements which is characteristic for Charlie Chaplins slapstick scenes. Afterwards he looks around and discovers a crying baby laying between a wall and some trashcans. Meanwhile a young mother walks past in the background with a pushchair and a baby. Chaplin sees her and as she shortly walks into a house he places the baby next to the child of the unknown women. Unfortunately she walks out again just in this very moment and does not seem amused at all. So he then tries something else and carries the baby back to the place where he found it. Just as he turns around to walk away a man in uniform stands a few steps behind him giving him a strict look that makes Chaplin taking the child back on immediately. Another set appears, Chaplin walks down a street to an old man and hands him the baby, pretending to fix his shoe laces so he can run away. The old man chases him but is not able to move fast enough. He walks past the pushchair of the lady from the first scene and tries the same trick as Chaplin did before. He gets along with it but as soon as the mother walks out a magazine door and sees the second child she starts to search the street. Chaplin passes by, thinking himself safe as the mother runs after him and slaps him with her umbrella. He has to take the baby back and in the last scene he sits down on the street with the little child in his arm wondering what to do with it. Looking at its face and little clothing he discovers a piece of paper, unfolds it and after reading he know nows that this is an orphan child someone hoped that good people would care about. He smiles and then walks off into the distance, carrying his new child.

Mister Chaplin enters a small alleyway. After he lights a cigarette, he finds a newborn next to a trashcan. While he tries to figure out where the child’s mother might be, a woman with a baby stroller enters the stage. Assuming she is the mother, he lays the newborn into the stroller, next to the woman’s child. As she is not the mother, she indignantly urges him to pick up his child and leaves the alleyway. While Mister Chaplin is laying down the newborn next to the trashcan again, a police officer enters the alleyway – Mister Chaplin is forced to take the child again. By a trick he hands over the child to a stranger, who is laying down the child in the baby stroller of the mother, who entered the alleyway earlier. After that Mister Chaplin walks across the stroller and, again, gets forced to pick the child up by the woman and the patrolling police officer. Not knowing what to do next, he sits down on the sidewalk and finds a letter, hidden in the child’s blanket, saying he should take care of the orphan. He seems to compassionate the child, takes it in his arms, gets up and leaves the stage.

column39: Background readings about the task topic (newspapers, internet, TV, etc.)
column40: Charles Chaplin walks around the streets and he finds a baby. He searches for the mother and thinks that one woman is the mother but she is not. He wants to leave the baby where he found it but a police officer sees him and Charles takes the baby with him. When he meets an old man he gives the baby to him and walks away. The man Hands the baby over to the mother Charles wanted to give the baby to as well. The mother wants Charles to take the baby back and he sits down and finds a piece of paper in the babys blanket. He shall Keep the baby and care for it. So he does.

Charlie Caplin walks down a street. Things are thrown after him or just falling down from above. Behind a trashcan he finds a little baby wrapped in a blanket. A woman with a buggy walks by and he is thinking that she lots the baby and puts it into her buggy. Then she is in rage and tells him that this is not her baby. Charlie goes back to the place where he found the baby and lays it down, right back behind the trashcan. A police officer appears and seems to think that Charlie tries to abandon the baby. To avoid serious trouble, Charlie takes the baby with him down the street. He asks an old man with a walking stick to hold the baby for a moment and runs way. The old man can't find Charlie, but spots a buggy (the same of the woman at the beginning of the story) and lays the baby in the buggy and runs away. Charlie walks by a few seconds later and the woman comes out of a store, finding the foreign baby in her buggy again. She sees Charlie and beats him with her umbrella. Again the police officer walks by, to avoid serious trouble again, Charlie takes the baby and sits down the street on the sidewalk. He thinks about to throw the child into a sewer, but rejects that thought. He finds a letter in the blanket, which says to care for this orphaned child. He smiles at the baby and takes it with him.

Charlie Chaplin discovers a baby in a dirty side alley and tries to get rid of it. First, he tries to put it in a stroller with another baby, but gets yelled at by the mother. Then he wants to put it back where he found it, but a police officer sees him. And lastly, he gives it to an old man and flees. After his attempt to follow Chaplin, the old man puts the baby in the same stroller in that Chaplin layed it before while the mother was not looking. Chaplin walks by as the mother found the second baby again and the police officer joins to their discussion, thus Chaplin taking the baby again. At last, Chaplin found a note pleading the finder of the kid to love and care for it and marking it as an orphan. Chaplin then takes the baby with him.

Charlie Chaplin's Film deals with a foundling which he notices laying on the street and his struggle to seek out a place where he could leave the child without feeling guilty. Since his attempts of leaving the baby in another woman's stroller remain unsuccessful and the idea of giving the baby to strangers turns out the same way, he gets used to keeping the baby. As he finds a note in the baby's clothes which bid the person finding the child to love it and care for it, it seems like Chaplin decides to do so.

The film shows a man, who is wandering along a road until he finds a baby. First he attempts to get rid of it by giving it to other people or leaving it alone. Nevertheless, it does not work and nobody wants to have the orphan child. Throughout the video, he develops compassion and sympathy which is the reason why he then decided to keep the baby and take care for it. Eventually, he was thinking that it was his destiny to find the little child and assume responsibility.

In the beginning of the Chaplin video, Charlie Chaplin walks down a street, while rubbish gets thrown out of the houses above him and hits him. At the end of the street Charlie finds a baby laying on the ground, in the corner. He picks the baby up and turns around. In that moment, he sees a woman with stroller walk by. Charlie immediately walks up to the stroller, thinking it is the woman’s baby. So he puts the baby in it. When she sees the baby, she confronts Charlie with it and tells him to take the baby out since it is not hers. After he took the baby out, he walks back to the corner and wants to put it back. That is when a police officer walks by and notices him. So Charlie takes the baby and walks away. Around the corner he sees an old man walking by. Who he then outwits into holding the child. While the old man is holding the baby, Charlie quickly runs off and hides. So the old man walks down the street, with the baby in his hands, he sees the woman with the stroller and puts the baby in it. After that he runs away. Later, Charlie comes out of his hiding place and walks down this street in the exact moment that the woman notices the foreign child in her stroller. She sees Charlie and runs after him, hits him with her umbrella and tells him to take the baby. He again ist forced to do so, since the police officer was walking by in the same moment. So he sits down at the roadside, contemplating to put the baby in the drain. He does not do it. While he is holding the baby, he suddenly cuts hisself on so piece of paper which was hidden in the baby’s blanket. He takes it out and reads what is written on it. The paper reads: “ Please love and care for this orphan child. “
Suddenly Charlie gets very emotional and decides to take care of this orphan child.

Chaplin walked through a street, where a lot of violence happens. Suddenly he found a child on the street. In the following he tried to find hie mother but he wasn't successful. The whole set up is looks really dirty and destroyed.

The black-white silent movie begins with a man (Chaplin) going for a walk. During his walk he is hit by items which are thrown out of windows above him. He is upset and lits a cigeratte. He then finds and picks up a crying baby in the corner and wonders if it was thrown out as well. When he sees a mother with a buggy he considers the baby to be hers and lays it in her buggy while she leaves for a moment. It turns out that it is not her baby and she angrily confronts him when she returns. Chaplin takes the baby and wants to put it back in the corner where he found it but a police officer interrupts him. Chaplin has no other choice than taking the baby with him. When he passes a stranger he gives him the baby and runs away. The stranger secretly puts the baby in the above-mentioned mother’s buggy and leaves. The mother returns and only a moment later Chaplin passes by. The mother accuses him for putting the baby in her buggy and beats him out of anger. When the police officer arrives she reports what happened and Chaplin takes the baby with him again. He sits down on a sidewalk and then finds a small piece of paper in the baby‘s blanket. In the anonymous letter someone asks to take care of the baby. Chaplin understands and walks away happily with the baby in his arms.

At the beginning of the video we can se Charles Chaplin with his suit, his cane and his hat, who is walking through the streets. While walking a man in an apartment is throwing out some building rubble, Chaplin is not getting hit by it but is cleaning his suit from the dusk. As he keeps walking there's another man who is throwing  rubbish out of the window. This time Chaplin get hit and is getting angry. To recover of the stress he's putting his cigarrettes out of a box in his pocket. Before starting to smoke he's pulling off his gloves. It seems like he lights the match on his shoe. While smoking he's looking around and recognizes a baby who is laying next to the rubbish bins. Chaplin starts looking around to find someone who might be the one responsible for the child, but can't find anyone. While he's grabbing the baby a woman with a stroller, with already one baby sitting in in, passes by. As soon as the woman stopped to go into the building Chaplin puts the baby he found in the woman's stroller. In this moment the woman is coming out of the door and starts shouting at him to make cleare, that it's not her child,. That's why Charles takes the child back into his arms again and is walking away. He wants to put the baby pack to the place where he found it but a police officer passed by at this moment, so Charles decided to walk away with the baby. On his way he comes across a older man with a walking stick, Charles is acting like tying his shoes to be able to put the baby into the arms of the old man. After a few seconds he starts running away and leaves the man alone with the baby. The old man starts running after him, but can't find Charles who is hiding behind a door. His way leads the man to the stroller of the woman earlier and like Chaplin did, he puts the baby in the stroller and runs away. As soon as Charles comes out of his hiding place he's running into the arms of the police officer again. Meanwhile the women comes out of the building and finds the baby again in her stroller. Charles walks by the stroller again and the woman recognize him and is starting to hit him with her umbrella whilst pulling him back to the stroller with the two babys. While arguing with the women the police officer passes by who became aware of the situation, the fight led to nothing and Charles grabs the baby again and walks away. He's sitting down on a kerb with the babys in his arms. Next to him is a discharge shaft and for a short moment he's thinking about putting the baby in there - but he decides otherwise. He's taking a closer look at the baby and finds a note in the cover which is saying "Please love and care for this orphan child". That's why he decides to take care of the lonely child and takes it with him.

In the beginning of the sequence Charles Chaplin walks along a street, smoking a cigar and  suddenly finds a little child laying on the ground. He picks it up, sees a lady with a pram walking past and points out to her that she lost something and lays the child in the pram. The lady is not amused and Charles Chaplin brings the baby back to where he found it but a policeman is watching him – so he keeps the child. Under the pretext of having to close his shoes, he gives the baby to a stranger and runs away. The stranger however lays the baby again in the woman’s pram who is in a shop in the meantime and the stranger leaves. Charles Chaplin walks past the pram in the moment when the woman sees the baby in her pram. In this moment the policeman arrives and after a short discussion Charles Chaplin leaves – together with the child. He sits down on a pavement. While considering what to do now, he finds a letter with the beg to care for the baby. Charles Chaplin smiles and walks away carrying the child in his arms.

In the beginning of the Chaplin video, Charlie goes down a street when he gets hit by garbage falling from the houses above. As he pulls out a cigarette to light up, he looks in the corner of the alley and finds a baby laying on the ground. When he sees a women with a stroller walking by, he immediately thinks it's hers and wants to give it back. The women was gone when he puts the baby inside the stroller. As soon as she saw the Baby in the stroller and Charlie standing next to it, they start to argue. After that, Charlie takes the baby and walks away with the intention to put it back in the corner of the alley. In the process of doing so, a police officer showed up behind Charlie. When Charlie noticed the officer he takes the baby again and goes away. As he walks down a street with the baby on his arms, he notices an old man. He outwits the old man by asking him to hold the baby while he ties his shoes. As soon as the old man was holding the baby, he runs away and hides in the alley, where he found the baby before. The old man walks to a road where he sees the stroller from the same women Charlie had argued with in the beginning. He puts the baby inside the stroller and runs away. Meanwhile, Charlie gets caught coming out of his hiding spot by the Police officer. Charlie runs away again, directly onto the street where the women was with the stroller. As he passes them, the woman recognises Charlie again and runs after him. She hits him with her umbrella and tells him to take the child back as the police officer walks up. Charlie is forced to take the baby back and goes away. As he sits down at the roadside, he considers to put the baby in the drain but doesn't do it. While he holds the baby, he cuts his finger on something and pulls out a piece of paper with the caption "Please love and care for this orphan child". He then gets emotional and takes the baby with him as he walks away.

The video starts in a little valley, looking very dirty. You see a women throwing her rubbish out of the window down on the street. A men walks along this valley, trying to avoid to get hidden by the dirt. But he isn't successful. At the end of the street a big amount of dirt falls exactly on his head. He looses the cigarette he was smoking, so he takes out another one. When he looks at the floor, he sees a little baby crying. He looks around to find out who might have lost it. When he sees a woman with a pram, he picks it up to bring it to her. They argue, probably because she says that this isn't her child. So he picks up the baby again and leaves. When he want's to lay the baby back where he found it, a police officer sees him. So he has to pick it up and take with him again. When he sees a men with a walking stick he decides to trick him. He pretends like he has to tie his shoes and therefore asks the men to hold the child. When the man agrees, he runs away. The man with the walking stick finds the same pram as the other men before and lays the baby in there. By coincidence, the man from the beginning walks along exactly when the woman finds the strange baby in her pram again. She catches the men and hits him with an umbrella. When the police officer arrives, he believes that the baby belongs to the men because he saw him with it before. So he takes it with him and sits down on a pavement. Under the blanket, with which the child is covered he finds a paper saying "Please love and care for this orphan child". He looks at the baby again and smiles. Suddenly it looks as if he is happy that he found it and leaves.

In the video the famous actor Charlie Chaplin walks down a alley, while people throw things, such as bricks out of their window and hit him. Afterwards Chaplin lights a cigarette and smokes, until he sees a baby lying on the floor. While he tries to find the parents of the baby, he gets admonished by a woman with a baby buggy and two police officers. Finally, he ends up finding a note in the blanket of the baby, in which the finder of the baby is asked to take care of it. Chaplin takes the baby, walks away and the video ends.

In the video a character, acted out by Charles Chaplin, is walking through a small street where people living in the houses on both sides of the street keep throwing their garbage out of the window. One man dumps it right on  the main characters’ head. Right next to a lot of garbage on the ground and a dumpster the main character finds a little baby, covered by a blanket, right in the ground. First he does not know what to do with it, so he leaves the baby with a woman walking another baby in a cart. But she tells him to take his baby back. When he tries to put it back to where he had found it a police officer comes and tells him to keep the baby. After his attempt to leave the babyhe with an old man, who is not a really fast walker anymore, fails he sits down on the sidewalk and looks at the baby. While observing it, he finds a piece of paper in the bundle on which someone wrote “please love and care for this orphan child”. After reading the letter he seems happy and leaves with the baby.

in the video you can see a man walking down the road and a woman throwing out rubbish out of her window when he’s hit by rubbish for the second time he comes to a halt and takes out a cigarette / after that he sees a child lying on the ground and picks it up then in the background you can see a woman walking down the road with her stroller and an other baby in the stroller so he thinks that it’s a good idea to put the baby that he found into the stroller but after he does that the woman argues with him that it is not her child and he takes the baby back then he wants to put the baby back to the place where he found it but he encounters a police man so he picks up the baby and leaves the place in the next scene scene he meets an old man and gives the baby to him and runs away then he hides and the old man passes a shop where he sees a stroller and puts the baby into that stroller the stroller is the one that the man put the baby in before so in the next scene you can see the man passing the stroller and the woman that owns the stroller coming out of a shop and sees the man passing the stroller and he sees the other baby in her stroller so the woman follows him and is punching him with an umbrella you can also see a policeman coming to the scene so the man needs to take the baby again he walks away ‘n’ then he sits down on the side walk and then he opens the blanket in which the baby is covered and he finds a note saying that this child is an orphan and the child needs someone to love ‘n’ in the end of the scene you can see the m=man leaving with the baby

In the black and white video, you can see a man (Charlie Chaplin) walking down the street. A woman who lives in a house on the street throws rubbish out of the window. The rubbish falls on Charlie, but he continues walking. After he is hit by rubbish for the second time, he takes out a cigar and starts to smoke it. Then he sees a baby, wrapped up in a blanket, laying on the ground. He looks around but no one is there. He picks up the baby and as he turns around he sees a woman with a stroler and a baby in it. Charlie goes to the stroler and places the baby in it. The mother of the other baby is not pleased with Charlies action and argues. So he takes the baby out of the stroler and goes back to where he found it. There he puts the baby down on the street. As he starts to walk away a police officer occurs. Charlie turns around takes the baby and runs away. He meets an old man who is walking along the street and hands the baby over to him before the old man could agree. Then he hides from the old man. Stuck with the baby the old man walks past a stroler and puts the baby into it. The stroler belongs to the woman that Charlie wanted to give the baby to earlier. Charlie passes the stroler, in the same moment in which the woman sees the other child next to hers. She runs after Charlie, hitting him with an umbrella. She forces him to take back the baby. Charlie takes the baby and sits down on the sidewalk. He finds a note in the blankets, saying that someone should love this orphaned child. In the last sequence of the video, he smiles at the baby, and walks away.

In the video "The kid" Charlie Chaplin is walking through the dusty streets of a district. When he passes the houses he is always hit by objects that somebody throws out of the window. After a while he reaches a place of dustbins where there is no risk of falling items anymore. When he calmly smokes a cigarette he notices a bundle of clothes behind one of the containers. Charlie Chaplin soon finds out that there is a baby inside the bundle. At first, he assumes the baby fell out of a window, then he sees a mother with a child in a pushchair and thinks that this woman could have dropped the other baby. However, he tries to get the woman's attention in vain. That's why Charlie Chaplin simply puts the baby into the lady's pushchair. When the woman finds out that there is another baby in her child's pushchair she becomes very angry and insistes Charlie Chaplin to fetch back the baby. When Charlie Chaplin decides to put the baby back where he had found it he is caught by a policeman. In his next attempt to get rid of the baby Charlie Chaplin tries to give the little child to a man, who carries a walking stick.
The man does not want to be responsible for the baby and puts it again into the woman's pushchair. When the lady discovers that the strange baby is back in her child's pushchair she is very furious, chases Charlie Chaplin, hits him with her umbrella and forces him to fetch back the baby. Eventually, Charlie Chaplin feels so overwhelmed with his duty to care for the child that he considers to throw it into gully. When he discovers a note into the baby's bundle that begs the finder to lovingly care for this orphan Charlie Chaplin changes his opinion and decides to look after the child.

column40: Charlie is on a walk and finds a baby behind a garbage can. At the beginning the tried to get rid of the baby. He tries to put the baby unnoticed into a buggy with another child in it but the woman noticed him and he must take the baby back. After that, he tries to place the baby at the exact same place where he found it but a policeman sees him and Charlie took the baby and flees. Next, he gave it with a trick to an elderly man. This seems to work but the elderly man also sees the woman with the buggy and places the baby in it.  As Charlie walks by the woman notices that and follows him to punish him with her umbrella. Again, Charlie takes the baby with him. Resigned he sits down on a curb. One moment he considers the possibility to leave the little baby in a drain but he quickly discards this option. On closer consideration, he finds a note that asks to love and take care of the orphan child. Charlie decides to retain the child and walks away with the baby.

In the end he sat down with the baby, not knowing what to do he found a piece of paper, that was with the baby which said "Please love and care for this orphan child". Afterall he decided to keep the child

At the beginning of the video, the protagonist Charlie Chaplin finds a baby on the street by chance. Since he doesn't know what to do with the child, he tries to get rid of the kid, first by putting it into a somebody else's pram, maybe assuming that the child belongs to this woman, who, however, chases them away angrily. When Charlie wants to put the child back to where he found it, a police officer watches him, thinking that Charlie wants to abandon the child. After that Charlie takes off, together with the kid. He meets a passer-by, slipping the child into the passer-by's hand, before taking off again. The man who's got the child now unknowingly puts it into the same pram as Charlie did before. When the woman realizes that the unknown child is back again in her pram, she immediately thinks of Charlie who passes the street at that very moment. After getting beaten up by that lady and while argueing the police officer walks over and Charlie sees himself forced to take the child with him one more time. Then, he sits down on the roadside. When he notices a drain right next to him, he considers to throw the kid into it for a second but he decides not to do it. Shortly after, he finds a note in the child's cloth, saying that this child is an orphan that needs to be taken care of and that needs to be loved.

The first impression is the fact that this video is a black and white silent video with accompanying music and starts off with Charles Chaplin, who walks through an alley while people throw their dirt out of the window on his head. As he walks on he gets hit by stones coming from above extinguishing his cigar and the Words:"Akward ass" show up. While grabing and igniting a new cigar he finds a crying baby and tries to find the parents of the baby. The secong after a woman with a pram walks by and immediately Charles puts the baby in the pram saying:"Pardon, me you dropped something." with a suprising hostile reaction of the woman. Just after the interaction with the lady Charles carries the baby back to the place where he had found  it getting caught by a police officer and nervously picking up the baby again. On his way Charles met an elderly man tricking him into holding the baby whilst he ties his shoes and secretly runs away.While Charles arrived in the mentioned alley hidding from the old man, the old man is seeking for him but finds the pram of the lady Charles met earlier. Then when Charles leaves his hidding spot he gets confronted by the same police officer again and just as he had escaped the policeman Charles walks by the pram while the lady notices that the baby from earlier is yet again in her pram. The lady then sees Charles putting him into dust and dragging him to the pram. Now the policeman had arrived at the pram and both the lady and the policeman are forcing Charles to take the baby. At the end while still searching for a solution for the baby problem Charles finds a note with the writing:"Please love and care for this orphan child" After sitting on a wayside he stands up smilling the baby in his arms and walks away.

A man walks down a street, while accidentally getting thrown some dirt on him. Afterwards he finds a baby lying on the street and takes it with him. A woman with a baby carriage passes by and he puts the baby in it. The woman is angry, because it is not her child. He has to take it back and wants to get rid of it, so he puts it  back on the street where he found it, but a police officer walks by. Therefore the man has to take the baby again with him. He tries to trick an old man to hold the baby while he is pretending to tie his shoes and then runs away. The old man again puts the baby into the baby carriage of the same woman and walks away. The woman is again forcing the man (who picked up the baby in the first place) to take it back, as he is just accidentally passing by again. The man is now sitting down on the street with the baby in his arms and finds a letter within the cloths of the baby. The letter tells him to take good care of this orphan child and so he finally decides to do so.

Charles Chaplin walks down a street where he finds a baby on the ground. Not knowing who the baby belongs to he tries to search for anyone that might be related to the possibly lost child. Trying to give it to another mother or a random man on the street the baby finds its way back to him after each of these attempts. In the end he sits down with it hesitating if he should place it under a manshole cover. When he searches the baby for any information who it might belong to he finds a letter that says "Please love and care for that orphanage child". The last scene shows him hugging the child lovingly.

After walking through a narrow alley, Chaplin notices a baby lying next to a garbagecan. he then inspects the child, picks it up and tries to figure out who's responsible for it. After a few moments, he notices a woman with a stroller. He assumes it must be her child and lays the baby down. However, it seems like this is not the case and Chaplin has to continue looking for the baby's parents. He figures that they were going to pick the baby up eventually and leaves it where he found it, only to pick it up shortly after. A policeman came around the corner and to ihm, it must've looked like Chaplin was going to leave his own child in the alley. Chaplin then tries to hand the baby to an old man by tricking him to hold it while tying his shoes. He flees from the man, who comes by the lady with the stroller again and, just as Chaplin did before, assumes it's her baby. When the woman comes back to her stroller and the unfamiliar baby, she spots Chaplin walking by and punches him. She then hands him the baby. Chaplin, holding the baby again, sits down on the sidewalk when he notices a piece of paper inbetween the baby's blanket. The child appears to be an orphan and Chaplin smiles, looks at the child and walks away holding it.

The video "Charles Chaplin- the kid - the baby" starts with Charles Chaplin walking through an old housing estate. He is wearing a suit with a tie, a hat and gloves. He almost gets hit by something a woman throws out of her window. After litting a cigarette and getting rid of the gloves, a crying baby in a blanket on the floor draws his attention. He picks it up and looks around to see where it comes from. Then, he sees a woman strolling with a baby carriage with a baby. She leaves the carriage in front of a house and enters. Chaplin seizes this opportunity and puts his baby next to the other one in the carriage and says "Pardon me, you dropped something". The woman gets angry, then Chaplin takes the baby and leaves. He goes back to the place where he found it, wants to put it back on the floor but then, a man who appears to be an officer observes him which makes Chaplin take the baby with him. On his way, the crosses paths with an old man. He asks him to hold the baby while pretending to tie his shoes. Then, he runs away and hides. The old man follows him. He sees the same carriage with the baby Chaplin saw before. He puts in in and runs away. Meanwhile, Chaplin comes out of his hiding place and bumps into the officer. He then walks in the other direction, past the woman who comes out of the store and sees two babies in her carriage. She runs after Chaplin and hits him with an umbrella. Even though the video is voiceless, only with music put to it, you can tell that they are having a wild discussion.The officer sees that and listens to them without saying a word. Afterwards, Chaplin takes the baby and sits down on the pavement. After thinking about where to put the baby, he finds a piece of paper in its blanket that says "Please love and take care for this orpan child". Finally, the cuddles the baby, laughs at it and takes it with him.

In the video, a scene of a silent film is shown. Charly Chaplin is walking down a street while smoking a cigar. He is wearing a suit, a hat and carrying a walking stick. A person is dumping his or her trash out of the window; it is hitting Chaplins' head. Chaplin recognizes it and white letters saying "Awkward ass." appear on a black background. Chaplin lights another cigar with a match he lit on fire by rubbing it on his shoe. He wants to continue walking down the street, when he suddenly sees a baby laying on the ground. He picks it up and puts it in the stroller of a women standing nearby, in which another child is sitting. "Pardon me, you dropped something." appears on the screen. The women makes it clear, that she is not happy about the second child in her stroller and Chaplin takes it back out. As he wants to lay it where he first found it, a police officer appears and Chaplin walks away fast, carrying the baby. An elderly man appears and Chaplin hands him the baby. The man tries to catch Chaplin, but then sees the same stroller Chaplin saw earlier, standing in front of a store. He puts the baby inside of it and walks away. As the woman is coming out of the store, Chaplin is walking past the store. The woman is hitting him with her umbrella, thinking that he must have put the baby back in her stroller and she informs the police officer about it. Chaplin walks away, carrying the baby and he sits down next to a drain cover, first contemplating wether he should put the baby into the drain, but he decides against it. He finds a note in the babys cover, which reads "Please love and care for this orphan child." He looks moved, then smiles at the baby, gets up and walks away with it.

In the video, Charly Chaplin finds a baby lying in the street. It seems that the baby was abandoned by its parents. Charly looks around and tries to find the parents but he does not find them. After a short while he loses interesst in the baby and wants to get rid of it. At first he sees a woman with a perambulator with a child in it. When the woman looks away he tries to sneak his baby inside the perambulator but the woman catches him and chases him off. Then Charly tries to put the baby where he found it and walk away but there is a police officer that prevents him from doing that. After that Charly gives the baby to a man that is walking by. The man, while being in total confusion, runs after him. Charly hides behind a wall and the man sees the perambulator of the woman earlier. He droppes the baby there and walks away. After a short while the woman comes back and gets angry when she sees the strange baby in her perambulator again.
In the meantime, Charly walks by, happy to got short of his little problem. The woman regonices him and forces him to take the baby back.
Charly, now being completely devastated sits down with the baby in his arms. He examines the baby and finds a note. The note says: "Please love and care for this orphan child". Charly now realises that the child has no one but him in the world and decides to keep the baby for now.

Chaplin walks along the street. Someone is throwing stuff out of the window of a house and it hits Chaplin. Chaplin starts swearing and smoking a cigarette. When he is looking around he finds a baby laying on the floor. He picks it up and tries to put it in in the stroller of a woman with another baby but the woman catches him and argues that it's not her child. Chaplin tries to put the baby back on the floor but a policeman arrives so Chaplin reconsiders his decision. Instead, he hands the baby to an old man and runs away. The old man puts the baby back into ther stroller of the woman Chaplin met before.The woman assumes that it was Chaplin and starts hitting him with an umbrella. The policeman arrives again  and the woman tells him the story. Chaplin has to take back the baby. He sits down with it and finds a letter in its clothes saying that the baby is an orphan. He feels sorry for the baby, interacts with it and finally leaves holding it closely to his breast.

The man in the video walks down an alley, in which people throw trash out of their windows. He does not get hit by the trash from the first window but the second. He is annoyed by that and lights himself a cigarette. While smoking he found a baby and wanted to return it to a woman it did not belong to, which lead to a number of failed attempts to get rid of the baby. Turns out the baby was dropped off there with a note asking the finder to love and care for the baby. The last scene shows the main character with the baby sitting on a sidewalk.

We see Charlie Chaplin walking through a dirty street. While doing so a woman throws her trash out of the window and almost hits him. A few seconds and meters later, an unknown persons who we do not see, does the same and hits him. Charlie is obviously angry and lights a cigarette. Just seconds after that he finds a baby, covered in sheets laying on the ground. He wonders if it was also just thrown out of the window or to whom it belongs. As a woman with a baby carriage passes by he chases her and wants to put it back in there because he believes that she lost one of hers. The woman gets furious as it turns out not to be her child and he walks away with the orphan. Charlie seems to be unable to cope with the situation and tries to get rid of the baby. But as he puts it back to the place where he found it, a policeman catches him and he instantly picks it back up. Still trying to get rid of the baby, he gives it to an old man who can barely walk and runs away. But the old man comes up with the same idea as Charlie did, he puts the baby inside the buggy of the woman. Unfortunately she realizes that the orphan was put in her baby carriage the moment Charlie walks past. She chases him down, beats him up and makes him take the baby. He has no other choice than to do so because the policeman appears again. Frustrated by the situation, Charlie sits down on the curb and even thinks of throwing the orphan in the drain. A few moments later, after finding a letter which says "please love and care for this orphan child", his mood suddenly lights up and he feels responsible. At the end he walks away with the baby and disappears in a small side street.

Charlie Chaplin walks around a poor, 'ghetto-like' looking part of a town, where he  gets hit by falling debris. Wondering where it came from, he starts looking around. As he passes some trashcans, he finds a baby laying behind them. He picks it up and holds it close to him. He again starts looking around, now wondering who might left the baby on the floor. A few moments later, a mother with her child in a stroller walk by. He sees this as an opportunity to leave the baby to this mother and puts the baby to hers in the stroller. After realizing what Chaplin has done, the mother angrily tells him to take the baby back. As the mother turned him down, Chaplin just puts the baby back where he found it. In exact this moment, a police officer passes and just watches him. Chaplin realizes that he is being watched and therefore decides to pick the baby up again, so he will not get arrested. He now walks through the neighbor, looking for a solution. When he walks past by a random bystander, he asks him to hold the baby for a moment, but then starts running away and hides. The man who holds the baby now, is confused and puts the baby in the same stroller from the mother, from the beginning of the film. Chaplin, sure about his accomplishment, casually walks by the mother again, but she recognizes him and attacks Chaplin and drags him back to the stroller, asking him to take the baby back. They start to argue, but when the police officer passes again, Chaplin willingly takes the baby back, again to avoid a punishment. It now seems like, that Chaplin gave up. He sits down next to the road while holding the baby. He takes a closer look a founds a letter with the text "Please love and care for this orphan child". As he read the text he starts smiling and walks off with the baby in his hands.

In the video you will see Charlie Chaplin being hit with some garbage. Afterwards he will find an orphan baby and tries to get rid of it while encountering several persons yet without success. First you will see him try to give the kid to a woman with another child though she seems very unpleased. Also when he is trying to set it back onto the ground he will encounter an policeman preventing him from that. Afterwards he gives the baby to an man who seems to have trouble walking. column40: At the beginning of the video Charles Chaplin is walking down the alley while some people are throwing stuff out the windows. Suddenly someone throws stuff and insults towards Chaplin. After that he pulls out a case and looks for a cigarette  and throws his gloves into a trash bin. After that he noticed a crying baby in the alley. While picking the baby up a woman with a stroller is walking past them. Chaplin notices the stroller and tries to put the baby in the stroller. The woman was furious as Chaplin said that she had dropped something. He had to pick the baby up again because it wasn't the baby of that woman. As Chaplin is trying to place the baby back into the alley a officer is walking by and so he's picking the baby back up. He then askes an elder man to hold the baby for a moment to tie his laces. While the elder man is holding the baby, Chaplin is making a run for it. He's hiding in the alley and the elder man passes by the stroller of the lady before. The elder man deploys the baby in the stroller and runs off. The woman noticed the other baby in the stroller as Chaplin was walking by and then she suckerpunched Chaplin with a umbrella. The officer also passed by and Chaplin took the baby and went off. He then sits down and considers to throw the baby in the sewerage.Chaplin notices a letter on the baby which said that someone should take care of the baby.

column11: English Linguistics, English Literatures, University Language Skills
column39: Bilingual dictionary (German/English), Background readings about the task topic (newspapers, internet, TV, etc.)
column40: Charlie Chaplin is walking down a dirty alley while people are throwing their trash out of the window. As someone throws his trash right where he is standing, he pauses, lights a cigarette and recognize a baby to his left lying on the ground. Meanwhile a woman with a stroller walks by and Chaplin assumes that the baby belongs to her. He lays it down in the stroller but when the woman sees him she gets angry and tells him to take the baby back. He then takes the child again and wants to put it back to where he found it, but because a policeman is watching him he leaves with the baby in his arms. After that he walks by an old man and ask him to hold the baby as he wants to tie up his shoe. But he is just pretending and leaves without the baby. The old man then walks through the streets, looking for a way to get rid of the baby. He sees a stroller, put the baby in it and leaves as well. The stroller is the one belonging to the woman Chaplin met before. When she gets out of the store she gets upset because the baby is back with her. At the same time, Charlie Chaplin walks by and she then assumes that he is responsible for it again and hits him with an umbrella. The police man joins the situation and Chaplin better leaves with the baby because the woman accuses him. Without knowing what to do he sits down on the curb. While he is looking at the baby he finds a piece of paper that states that someone should please love and take care of the orphan. Touched by this he stands up and leaves, holding the baby in his arms.

At the beginning of this short video sequence, we see Charlie Chaplin walking down the street. After a few metres, he gets hit by bricks which seem to have been thrown down at him from someone in the house on the side of the street. Charlie Chaplin looks confused and tries to figure out who threw them at him. He then grabs a box with cigarettes and lights one with his show. While smoking, he takes closer looks at the surroundings and notices a baby on the ground, laying beside a garbage bin. Slowly, he approaches the bunch and looks at it, before taking it up and holding it in front of his face for closer inspection. He then searches for an opportunity to get rid of the baby and sees a woman with pram, which he then follows in order to lay down the baby in a moment when the woman does not pay attention to him. Unfortunately for him, she sees him and screams at him to take the child away. After that, Charlie Chaplin returns to the garbage bin and puts the baby back on the ground, when a police man appears behind him, urging him to take the baby back in his arms. Charlie Chaplin walks away and takes one last chance to get rid of the child when he gives it away to a beggar, before running away. The beggar looks confused, tries to follow him but can not manage to catch up. Instead, he passes the lady with the pram again, who again is not paying attention. The beggar puts the baby down in the pram, just like Charlie Chaplin did before, then walks away. At the same time when the lady enters the street again and discovers the second baby in the pram, Charlie Chaplin passes her. She confrontates him violently. At the end, Charlie Chaplin accepts the kid on his arm, sits down with it and reads a note that had been written for the person who finds it. "Please love and care for this orphan child", it says. Charlie Chaplin smiles, and walks away with the kid in his arms.

At first, you can see Charles Chaplin walking down an alley while somebody is throwing (probably bricks or similar) out of a window. Charles has to move out of the way to not get hit. He continues walking while he's havin a smoke. He then gets hit by somebody else throwing out bricks. He dusts himself off and lights another cigarette. Afterwards he finds a baby laying on the floor which he wants to give to a woman who is strolling by with a trolley but it appears that it's not her kid. Charles takes the kid and wants to put it back where he found it. But a police officer walks by and gives him a warning look. Charles then picks the baby back up and continues walking. He passes an older gentleman, puts the baby in his arms and runs away to hide. The old man sees the trolley and puts the baby into it without the woman noticing and walks off. Next thing you see is Charles coming out of his hiding place. He walks past the woman who sees the baby back in her trolley and follows Charles and calls the police officer. Charles then takes the baby and continues his journey. He sits down and seems to think. He then finds a note in the baby's pocket which reads: Please love and care for this orphan child. He smiles at the baby and walks off the scene with the kid in his arms.

The Chaplin Video shows Charles Chaplin who walks across a place between buildings. Suddenly, he gets hit by several stones or trash someone seems to have thrown towards him. After that, he lights a cigarette and discovers a baby lying on the floor. He decides to take the crying baby and put it into the stroller of a woman with another child. The woman gets angry, so Chaplin takes the baby back to the place where he found it. A police officer appears and watches him curiously. Chaplin has no other choice but to take the baby again in his arms and to walk around the corner. When he sees a man walking around, he attempts to hand the baby over to him and to escape. The man follows Chaplin angrily and puts it into the stroller of the mother and disappears quickly. When the mother realizes that the baby sits in her stroller for the second time, she beats Chaplin with her umbrella as he walks by. The police officer appears again, so Chaplin has - again - no other choice but to take the baby with him. So he sits down on the floor and thinks about how to handle this situation. Suddenly he finds a note between the sheets of the baby's clothes. The note says: "Please love and care for this orphan child". Chaplin smileys and leaves together with the baby.

The film starts with Charlie Chaplin walking between two big scabby building complexes while someone else is throwing recklessly bricks out of the window from the first floor without noticing Charlie Chaplin passing. Chaplin continues walking until he finally is hit by the litter of someone else's dustbin. Between garbage cans, he eventually notices a crying baby, wrapped up in a cloth, which someone must have left there on purpose. Chaplin picks the baby up and looks for someone to whom the baby might belong to. Eventually, a woman passes while pushing a pram with a baby inside. Chaplin assumes that the baby he found on the floor belongs to her and that she obviously must have dropped it without noticing. However, she makes clear that it is not hers and also feels rather offended by Chaplin's assumption. Chaplin takes the baby out of the pram and intends to lay it back to the place where he found it. He stays not unnoticed though as a policeman watches Chaplin. So instead of getting help by the officer, Chaplin prefers to take the baby with him and obviously wants to drop it somewhere else. Then an old stranger with a walking stick comes in handy and Chaplin gives the baby to him and runs away afterwards. The old man,  however, does not want to keep it and is desperately looking for Chaplin to return the baby but without any success. When the old man sees a pram left alone in front of a shop, he sees his chance to get rid of it and finally puts the baby in the pram. As the woman, to whom the pram belongs to, comes out of the shop and notices the  baby she suspects Chaplin again who is, unfortunately, passing the pram right at that moment. After all, Chaplin is given back the baby and keeps it after he found a tag lying between the layers of the cloth saying that the baby is an orphan and needs someone to love and care for it.

While walking  down an alley and being several times hit by debris seeming to fall down from the houses rooftops, Charlie Chaplin stops to light a cigarette and discovers a baby lying on the ground right next to a dustbin. He picks it up and not knowing what do do with it puts it into a womans‘ baby carriage who was walking by. The woman catches Chaplin trying to put the baby next to her own baby and reacts angry. She moves on and Charlie puts the baby back on the ground where he found it but the moment he turns around and sees a police officer behind him who witnessed this scene, he picks the baby up again and walks on. He spots an older man with a walking stick and asks him to hold the baby in order to tie his shoe but then runs away. The man sees the womans‘ baby carriage as well and puts the baby in it. Unfortunately, the moment Chaplin walks past the womens‘ carriage, she discovers the baby and assuming that Chaplin has put it again in the carriage, starts hitting him with her umbrella. The police officer walks towards them and wanting to avoid a conflict with him, Charlie takes the baby and runs off. Finally, he sits down on a curb with the baby in his arms. He discovers a draining grid and looks at the baby as if he was thinking about putting it in there.Then, he notices a note in the babys‘ clothes which says that the baby is an orphan and demands the finder to love and care for the child. This seems to change Chaplin‘s mind. He holds the baby tight to his chest and walks happily away.

Charles Chaplin walks down a backstreet as a man throws a few bricks out of the window above him. However, he doesn't seem to care and keeps on walking while he smokes a cigarette. Suddenly, as Chaplin walks by a garbage bin, someone throws trash out of an apartment, which is probably meant to fall into the bin but misses it and falls on the comedian instead. He loses his cigarette but instantly reaches out for another one in his pocket.
A baby lies hidden next to a different garbage bin in the same backstreet and as Charles Chaplin notices it, he thinks that someone threw the baby out of a window aswell.
A woman with a baby carriage crosses his way and he says "Pardon me, you dropped something". But the woman explains that it isn't her baby.
During his try to put the baby back to its hiding spot, a policeman walks by and seems angry about it.
Charles takes the baby and walks down a different street and asks an old man to hold it since he has to retie his shoe.
However, he takes his chance and runs away. The old man tries to follow him and walks by the same baby carriage as Charles did before. He lies the baby down next to the other baby and leaves.
Charles Chaplin leaves his hiding spot and accidentally crosses the woman with the baby carriage. The woman hits him with an umbrella and forces him to take the baby again.
At the end, he sits down on a sidewalk next to a drain and thinks about hiding the baby in there.
After all, Chaplin pulls a letter out of the baby's blanket, which says "Please love and care for this orphan child". He glances at the baby and seems very happy as he stands up and walks away from the scene.

column40: The location in the video presented is a street or a backyard, in which several bins are standing next to the walls. In the back a person is throwing things out of the window. A person, presumably Charly Chaplin, walks underneath that window. He realises the things falling down from above, but is not noticeably disturbed by it. He starts smoking and moves into the foreground. Then again, things are falling down from above. A text appears: 'Awkward ass'. Charly Chaplin takes a look into the bin next to him. He pulls a cigarette out of a metal box and puts it into his mouth. The, he takes off his gloves and lits the cigarette. He throws his gloves into the bin. Following his view, we can see a baby laying on the ground next to a wall. Chaplin watches out for people. He picks up the baby and moves into the back. He raises his arm to get the attention of a woman passing by. We see a buggy. Charly Chaplin puts the baby into the buggy. The woman appears and both argue, presumably about who is going to take care of the baby. Charly takes the baby out of the buggy and both persons leave in different directions. As Charly lays down the baby, a policeman arrives. Charly turns around, spots the policeman and picks the baby up again. In a different location we can see a man walking next to Chaplin. Charly indicates that he wants to tie his shoelaces and hands the baby over to the man. Then he runs into the back. The man follows Charly, who hides in a garage. The man lays the baby down into another buggy, in which we can also spot another baby. Then he leaves. Charly comes out of his stash, running into the policeman. He is passing by the buggy with the two babys. The same woman from earlier comes out of a house, sees Charly and follows him. She hits him with an umbrella and then drags him towards the buggy. They start arguing again. The policeman notices the two people arguing. Charly takes the baby out of the buggy again and leaves. He sits down on the sidewalk, shortly considering to throw the baby down the drain. He finds a note in the baby's clothes and reads: 'Please love and care for this orphan child'. Then he looks at the baby and takes it with him.

The excerpt of the movie shows how the protagonist Charlie finds a new born baby besides some trash cans. Suprised by his find, he thinks about what he should do with the baby and quickly decides to return the baby to his parents. The woman thate he assumes to be the mother of the child reacts harsh when Charlie attemps to return the child to her since it is not her kid. Afterwards Charlie tries to leave the child alone. Suddenly he finds a piece of paper attached to the child where it says that the person who finds the child should take care of it because it is a orphan child. Hence Charlie ultimately decides to take the child with him.

Charlie Chaplin is walking through a street in an industrial area of a town, which is shown by old brick buildings and a lot of trash that is laying all over the street. He grabs into his pocket, pulls out a little box and takes out a cigarette, which he shoves into his mouth. In this moment, he notices a baby laying besides one of the trash cans. He looks around, looking for the parents or any other person, who is responsible for the child. He sees a lady walking by, stops her and puts the baby inside her wagon. The woman is not happy about it and tells him to get the baby out of her wagon, because it is obviously not hers. A policeman is standing beside Chaplin, as he tries to lay the baby back to where he found it, but takes it back from the ground, as he notices that he is being watched by him. Chaplin proceeds trying to find someone, who will take care of the baby, but no one seems to be responsible. In the end, Chaplin sits at the sidewalk and reads a letter, which is attached to the babys blanket. Written there is a begging to whoever finds the child in the street, asking the finder to take care of it, because it's an orphan. Chaplin smiles and walks away, with the baby in his arms.

column40:
The video depicts Charlie Chaplin, a known slapstick comedian from the early 20th century. The scene starts with Chaplin accidentally discovering a abandoned baby on the side of a street. During the video he continuously tries to get rid of the baby.
First, he puts it in a baby carriage to another baby, but the mother makes him take the abandoned child back again. After that, he tries to put it back where he found it, but a policeman notices Chaplin, so he quickly takes the child with him again. Later, he gives the baby to an old man, acting like he has to tie his shoes, but then he hastily runs away and hides. The old man then puts the baby into the carriage of the mom from the scene before. She comes out of a shop, sees the strange baby and then Chaplin and starts to drag him back to the carriage. The policeman approaches and they both make Chaplin take the child back. He then sits down with the baby on his arm and considers throwing it down a drain, but then finds a note in the child's cloth. It reads "please love and care for the orphan child". He then smiles at it and takes it with him.

Chaplin picks a cigarette and starts smoking it. When walking around, he finds a baby and takes it with him trying to find the mother. He then thinks he has found her, puts the baby in a stroller that belongs to a woman. However, this is not the right mother, so she gets a little angry and he takes the baby back: unfortunately, he takes the wrong baby out of the stroller. He puts the baby back on the floor where he found it before, being watched by a police officer. That's the reason why he decides not to leave the baby and instead gives it to another man. This man leaves it in the stroller where Chaplin had put the baby before too. The woman gets furious and tells the officer. The officer makes Chaplin keep the baby, so that is why the scene ends with Chaplin holding the baby, actually being happy and caring about it.

Wanting to place the baby where he found it, a police man catches him which forces Chaplin to pick it up once again. However, the man finds the baby buggy of the woman Chaplin met earlier and places the baby inside of it. Coming out of his stash, Chaplin passes the woman and her buggy. He sits down on the sidewalk with the baby and finds a note saying "Please love and care for this orphan child" which eventually makes him keep the baby.

Charlie Chaplin is walking along a street, smoking a cigar. A woman throws something out of the window, but Charlie walks on unconcerned. Farther into the lane he finally gets hit by some rubbish someone threw out of the window. Hence his cigar fell on the ground, he takes a new one out of his tiny metal box, which he carries in his chest pocket. When he throws his gloves away he suddenly sees a baby lying on the ground between the rubbish. He picks the baby up and tries to pass it to a woman with a carriage, that randomly passes by. Since the baby does not belong to her, she forces Charlie to take it back. Charlie does not know what to do with the baby, so he tries to put it back where he found it. Unfortunately, a policeman comes by so Charlie is not able to drop it in the lane. Ich tricks an old man into holding the baby and runs away. The man leaves the baby in the woman’s carriage, who is nor amused about it and thinks Charlie left it there. As he passes by the woman forces him to take the baby with him by calling for the policeman. Charlie is clueless about what to do with the baby, so he sits down on the sidewalk and while playing around he finds a letter, that says “please love and care for this orphan child”. Charlie is affected by the letter and decides to care for the baby.

The short film "The kid- the baby", produced by Charlie Chaplin, deals with Charles accidently finds an abbonded baby next to some garbage containers.
During the narrative of the silent short film, Charlie unwillingly carries the child with him, but looks for every opportunity to get rid of the child. After many failed attempts to give the kid away, he tries to accept the little orphan and take care of him.

He's sitting down on the pavement, thinking about how to get rid of the child when he finds a note, apparently written by the baby's mother. The note says to please love and care for the orphan which Charlie finally decides to do.

Chaplin walks around a city and tries to avoid being hit by garbage that is thrown out of windows onto the streets. In doing so he suddenly sees a baby lying next to a trash bin. He looks around to find out where the baby could come from. He lifts the baby up and notices a woman pushing a pram. Chaplin considers the woman to be the baby's mother and therefore he follows her and puts the baby into the pram. There is another baby already in there, though. The woman gets mad and makes Chaplin leave and take the child with him. Chaplin tries to get rid of the baby and puts it next to the trash bin where he has found it. At the same time a police officer passes by and Chaplin lifts the baby up again. Then he passes the baby to an old man he meets in the streets, pretending to having to tie his shoe. He runs away and hides from the man. However, the old man cannot find Chaplin but sees a pram standing in front of a shop. There is another baby already in it and the man puts the baby into the pram next to the other child. When a woman leaves the shop it turns out to be the same pram which Chaplin has tried to put the baby into shortly before. Chaplin leaves his hiding place and passes the pram. The mother recognizes him, thinks he was the one who put the baby into the pram again, follows him and hits him with an umbrella. She tries to make him take the baby but he refuses until the police officer arrives whom Chaplin has met before. Chaplin takes the baby, leaves and sits down at a footpath. Next to him there is a drain and he considers whether to put the baby into it but he decides against this.When frisking the cloths the baby has been wrapped in he finds a piece of paper. The letter says that the baby was an orphan and begs the finder to love and take care of it. Chaplin smiles and cuddles the baby and leaves with the baby on his arms.

column22: Cambridge Certificate Advanced English C1, Cambridge Business English C1
column40: The excerpt from Charlie Chaplin's film "The Kid" deals with the protagonist wandering aimlessly through rather dirty backyards and eventually discovering an abandoned baby wrapped in blankets. As he feels obliged to take care of the baby and cannot leave it lying next to a dustbin, he secretly tries to give it to a woman who passes with a pram and her own baby. This attempt to rid himself of the baby fails and thus the protagonist even considers to simply return the baby to the backyard where he found it. However, a police officer watches him and so he gives it to another man who then himself places the unwanted baby in the woman's pram. She suspects the protagonist and accuses him in front of the officer, which results in the protagonist's flight. As he eventually sits down, he finds and reads a piece of paper which was wrapped in the baby's blankets. This note declares that whoever finds this orphan child should care for it. Finally, the protagonist decides to follow the instructions and aquires a taste for being given the responsibility of caring for the abandoned baby.

column40:
Charles Chaplin - The kid - The baby

the video clip of "Charles Chaplin - The kid - the baby" posted by Ana Diaz Negrillo on youtube on the 25th of November 2016 shows a mute scene of the protagonist Charles Chaplin who finds an abandoned baby and repeatedly tries to get rid of it, but in the end fails to get through with it.

The opening scene shows Charles Chaplin leaving a house. Once he is out on the streets he nearly gets hit two times by garbage, thrown out of the window above him. After lighting his cigarre he comes across an abandoned baby, lying on the ground beside him. He lifts the baby into his arms and notices a woman walking by with a pram. Mr Chaplin assumes that the baby belonges to her and lays it down into the pram. the women however rejects the baby since it does not belong to her. The protagonist then tries to leave the baby at the spot he found it. A policeman observed his crime and instructs him to keep the baby. Mr Chaplin then gives the baby to an old man he passes and immadeatly leaves. The old man, just as Mr Chaplin, lays down the baby into the same woman's pram and escapes rapidly. After noticing the baby in her pram she spots Mr Chaplin passing her and gives him the baby back with help from the policeman. Finally Mr Chaplin admitts defeat and gives up. however, he suddenly finds a piece of paper with a written message on it, saying to love the baby orphan and to care for it. Hence Mr Chaplin decides to keep the baby.
